summary: This document is an excerpt from a news article quoting lawyer Brad Edwards discussing Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking operation. Edwards represents over 150 of Epstein's accusers and explains the legal definitions of sex trafficking and how Epstein groomed victims for himself and his friends.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: He is quoted discussing how Epstein's connections enabled his trafficking operation and represents over 150 accusers, including a Polish model.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.context: She is mentioned as the law-firm partner of Brad Edwards, who together represent the Polish model and over 150 of Epstein's accusers.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as a sex trafficker who used his connections to traffic women, groomed victims for himself and his friends, and instructed women to report back on encounters.

connections.description: Law-firm partners who together represent over 150 of Epstein's accusers.
Edwards represents accusers who are suing Epstein's estate and describes Epstein's trafficking methods.
Epstein groomed victims for certain of his friends, with more than 20 men named as participants in sexual exploitation or abuse by trafficked women.

events.title: Post-2008 trafficking period
events.description: The article references Epstein's ability to traffic women after 2008, implying his connections were crucial for continuing his operation beyond this point.

keyFacts: Brad Edwards, representing over 150 of Epstein's accusers, states Epstein's 'legitimate connections to so many high-powered people' were essential for him to traffic most of the women after 2008.
Edwards states Epstein groomed some victims for certain of his friends, and that more than 20 men have been named as participants in sexual exploitation or abuse by women trafficked by Epstein.
Epstein often instructed the women to report back the details of their encounters with other men.
Legal cases have been filed against Epstein's estate and financial institutions that provided banking services to him.
